item.description:
Hoppy, malty, ale, lager? Is it all Greek to you? Or do you like to try the funky drafts at the hip beer bars in Allston, but wish you could "talk the beer talk?" Look no further, we have the series for you. Nate Kruback, a manager at our Watertown store, is taking his expertise westbound to the culinary center and is set on enlightening our beer palates and minds. This 3-part series will be a great introduction to tasting beer, its components, history, production, and the evolution of a complex industry. You're in for a real treat!

Class 1, Beer 101 will include:

* The History of Beer: Egyptians, Dark Ages/The Church, Brewpubs, Prohibition
* Craft Beers
* Production: Ingredients, styles, etc
* Beer & Food
* Evaluation of 5 different-styled beers

For more information, check out the Gordon's website.

Cost is $20 per person. .There is parking available on Prospect street, very close to the store

Mad Raven site: http://www.themadrave...
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be wearing a white sweater and jeans.
item.why: This seems like a great first look at the beer-making process. It's one of three events and it's in Waltham - what more do we need? After the event is over around 8:30PM, let's head over to The Mad Raven for a fun Friday night out.
item.name: Part 1: Beer 101 at Gordon's Fine Wine and Culinary Center
